name: (PLACEMENT) Text - Reading
questionContents:
Rewrite the sentence using 'Tired':

Although he was very tired, he agreed to help me with my homework.

Rewrite the sentence using relative clauses:

The man works for my father's company. The man's daughter is fond of dancing.

Rewrite the sentence starting with 'Martin apologized':

"I'm sorry, Angela, I'm afraid I've damaged your car," said Martin.

Rewrite the sentence starting with 'Maradona':

People think that Maradona is the best football player in the 20th century.

Rewrite the sentence starting with 'If':

Without your help, I couldn't overcome the problem.

name: (PLACEMENT) Choice - Reading
questionContents:
Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word 'critical':

One of the reasons why families break up is that parents are always critical of each other.

Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word 'post':

Using Facebook, you can post update sayings about your life everyday.

Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word CLOSEST in meaning to the underlined word 'efficient':

Adverts on Facebook seem to be more efficient than billboards or TV ads because of its enormous number of users.

Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word CLOSEST in meaning to the underlined word 'endeavoring':

After many year of unsuccessfully endeavoring to form his own orchestra, Glenn Miller finally achieved world fame in 1939 as a big band leader.

Choose the best answer to complete the sentence:

I can't stand ____________ people who are not tolerant of new ideas.

Choose the best answer to complete the dialogue:

Patient: "Can I make an appointment to see the doctor, please?"
Receptionist: "________"

Choose the best answer to complete the sentence:

I ____________ there once a long time ago and ____________ back since.

Choose the best answer to complete the sentence:

You can ____________ new words in the dictionary.

Choose the best answer to complete the sentence:

____________ you study for these exams ____________ you will do.

name: (PLACEMENT) Choice - Listening
questionContents:
Listen to the talk about Festival 1:

What is the name of the festival?

Listen to the talk about Festival 1:

What do people do in the festival?

Listen to the talk about Festival 1:

Which country is famous for this festival?

Listen to the talk about Festival 2:

Where is the festival?

Listen to the talk about Festival 2:

What do people throw in the festival?

name: (PLACEMENT) Text - Listening
questionContents: Listen to the conversation between a travel agent and a tourist and fill in the blank: Name of tourist

Listen to the conversation between a travel agent and a tourist and fill in the blank: Leave at

name: (PLACEMENT) Writing
questionContents: Write a short paragraph introducing yourself, including your name, age, occupation, and interests.

name: (PLACEMENT) Speaking
questionContents: Introduce yourself: Tell us your name?
Introduce yourself: where you are from?
Introduce yourself: what do you do?
